Get minimum of each column of data.frame

Source: R/batch.summarize.helpers.R
colMins2.Rd

Get minimum of each column of data.frame

Usage

colMins2(df, na.rm = TRUE)

Arguments

df

data.frame or matrix. Can include numbers stored as character or as factors.

na.rm

default is TRUE. not tested for FALSE

Value

named vector of numbers

See also

colMaxs2()

Examples

df <- rbind(NA, data.frame(
  n1 = c(0, 0:8), n2 = c(0.1 + (0:9)), n3 = c(1:10), 
  allnas = c(rep(NA, 10)),
  logic = TRUE, 
  factortxt = factor('factor'), 
  txt = 'words',
  numberlike = as.character(6:15),
  numberlikefact = factor(as.character(6:15)),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE))
  
df
#>    n1  n2 n3 allnas logic factortxt   txt numberlike numberlikefact
#> 1  NA  NA NA     NA    NA      <NA>  <NA>       <NA>           <NA>
#> 2   0 0.1  1     NA  TRUE    factor words          6              6
#> 3   0 1.1  2     NA  TRUE    factor words          7              7
#> 4   1 2.1  3     NA  TRUE    factor words          8              8
#> 5   2 3.1  4     NA  TRUE    factor words          9              9
#> 6   3 4.1  5     NA  TRUE    factor words         10             10
#> 7   4 5.1  6     NA  TRUE    factor words         11             11
#> 8   5 6.1  7     NA  TRUE    factor words         12             12
#> 9   6 7.1  8     NA  TRUE    factor words         13             13
#> 10  7 8.1  9     NA  TRUE    factor words         14             14
#> 11  8 9.1 10     NA  TRUE    factor words         15             15
colMins2(df)
#> Error in colMins2(df): could not find function "colMins2"
